questions.question_text: An organization is running SQL Server on-premises and is struggling with capacity and management overhead. They want to modernize this database quickly by using Google products or services. What should the organization do?

choices.C: Export old tables from SQL Server to Cloud Storage.
choices.D: Migrate all SQL Server data to BigQuery.
choices.A: Refactor applications to use a cloud first database like Firestore.
choices.B: Perform a managed database migration to Cloud SQL.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Cloud sql is google's fully managed database that supports sql servers in the cloud

B: Cloud SQL is Google Cloud's fully managed database service that supports SQL Server, among other databases like MySQL and PostgreSQL. By migrating to Cloud SQL, the organization can leverage a managed service that handles much of the database administration tasks such as patching, updates, and setup, thereby reducing management overhead.
Cloud SQL also offers automatic scaling capabilities, addressing the concern about capacity that the organization is facing with their on-premise solution.
Migrating to Cloud SQL would involve minimal changes to the existing applications since it supports SQL Server, allowing for a smoother transition without needing extensive application refactoring or redevelopment.

choices.A: Use a committed use discount to reserve a very powerful virtual machine

Selected Answer: C
Compute Engine offers sustained use discounts on resources that are used for more than 25% of a billing month and are not receiving any other discounts. Whenever you use an applicable resource for more than a fourth of a billing month, you automatically receive a discount for every incremental hour that you continue to use that resource. The discount increases incrementally with usage and you can get up to a 30% net discount off of the resource cost for instances that run the entire month.
https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/sustained-use-discounts?hl=en

questions.question_text:
Your organization needs a large amount of extra computing power within the next two weeks.
After those two weeks, the need for the additional resources will end.
Which is the most cost-effective approach?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Bigtable is a key-value and wide-column store, ideal for fast access to structured, semi-structured, or unstructured data. This makes latency-sensitive workloads like personalization a perfect fit for Bigtable. However its distributed counters, high read and write throughput per dollar makes it also a great fit for clickstream and IoT use cases, and even batch analytics for high-performance computing (HPC) applications, including training ML models.

Selected Answer: D
Cloud Bigtable is a fully managed, highly scalable, and high-performance NoSQL database service designed for large-scale applications that require low-latency and high-throughput data storage.

Selected Answer: A
https://cloud.google.com/products/databases?hl=en

Refer to above. Option is A

I believe Firestore is a more accurate answer for this question. It is a flexible, scalable NoSQL cloud database for storing and syncing data in real-time. In this case the question states "unstructured data" since its IoT so Firestore is recommended. 

BigTable can handle it too but the course says it's better suited for ">1 TB of semi-structured or structured data" and it also for analytical work which is not mentioned in this question at all.

questions.question_text:
Your organization is developing an application that will capture a large amount of data from millions of different sensor devices spread all around the world. Your organization needs a database that is suitable for worldwide, high-speed data storage of a large amount of unstructured data.
Which Google Cloud product should your organization choose?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. Organizations do not need to make upfront capital investments in cloud security.

The OpEx (Operational Expenditure) model for cloud security allows organizations to avoid large upfront costs for security infrastructure by paying for security resources on a subscription or pay-as-you-go basis. Benefits of this model include:

- Cost flexibility: No need for significant capital investments in hardware, as security services are typically offered on-demand.
- Scalability: Organizations can scale security services according to their needs without needing to invest in physical infrastructure.
- Faster adoption: Cloud security services are often ready to deploy, allowing organizations to quickly implement security measures without waiting for procurement or installation of hardware.

Selected Answer: A
Answer is A

choices.A: Organizations do not need to make upfront capital investments in cloud security.
choices.C: Organizations do not need to configure any security settings for cloud resources.
choices.B: Organizations can deploy custom security hardware.

questions.question_text: What is a benefit of the OpEx model for cloud security?
What is the benefit of using a serverless data processing pipeline service?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C is correct

C: Managed and Scalable: The primary advantage of serverless data processing services is that they abstract the underlying infrastructure management away from the user. This means the cloud provider manages the scaling, maintenance, patching, and availability of the servers. The service automatically scales up or down based on the workload, which can significantly reduce operational complexity and cost.

choices.D: Processed data is guaranteed to be free of errors.
choices.B: Processed data will not require analysis.
choices.C: Pipeline infrastructure is fully managed and scalable.
choices.A: Full control over compute resources is provided.
